I'm not going to pitch it quite *that* quickly.  For all I know (which isn't much) it may be the same and it was produced in Korea or something.  I just found it curious and thought maybe you knew more about it.  Maybe Kevin knows something, so I'll wait to see if he knows anything.  Even if it's not the same film, it's worth taking a look at for it's own sake.  I'm fond of Korean cinema as well.  And thanks for making these things available to us.  I, for one, truly appreciate the opportunity to see things I might not otherwise get a chance to see... Shinsengumi related or not.  (And I'll love you forever for the RK manga scanlation!  I'm in Saitou and Sano heaven!)
 
phil

Grace Battista <mg_batt@...> wrote:
Ya know what.... I think you should throw that out... I've never 
seen it myself... I just dug through a list that I had and I 
probably made a mistake because it showing up as some sort of manga, 
yes this is the result of having an unorganized list in streamload. 
Gomenasai Phil... I'll e-mail you when I get a "real" copy of Red 
Lion... *wounds runs away embarassed*

> Um... why is "Red Lion" listed as a Korean movie in the streamload

> phil
